entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 2:36AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels and Local Runoff Possible... Warming temperatures across the region later this week, combined with a much above normal snowpack over higher elevations, is/will cause a significant increase in snowmelt. Runoff into rivers south of the Brooks Range is causing water levels to rise and breakup to begin on some rivers. Local ice jams may form and result in

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 3:53AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Salt River near Etna affecting Lincoln County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. Smaller streams and tributaries flowing into the Salt River within Star Valley will continue to run near or above bankfull, and ponding of water in low-lying areas is likely through the week.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 3:35PM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: .Recent rainfall has combined with melting snow to raise water levels on the Sweetwater River. Smaller streams and tributaries flowing into the Sweetwater River around Sweetwater Station will continue to run near or above bankfull, and low-land flooding near the river is likely through at least midweek. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT SATURDAY...
